data.text: @Marcopelli1 He always has. He has a very long, very dark, history. The things he gets away with would make Mengele cringe I believe.

@memphis253 Some study science from a place of humility and benevolence.

Fauci comes from the darkness and is malevolent.
@toolboxybrown Yeah that stuff can be brutal and can cause all kinds of problems. I had my MIL taken off of it. It was bad bad news for her. It did seem to help my elderly dog in a tiny dose though.

@memphis253 >gabapentin
he was on that too. side effects were too much sometimes

@toolboxybrown If he's an older guy, getting relief that he needs that can't come from something natural, and blood work doesn't indicate low platelets or he gets infections it's probably okay. Better than gabapentin effects 😬

@memphis253 he's been on it for a while
easily over 3 years
@AndreaBotos2 Supposedly, the ritonavir binds to a certain receptor that allows the nirmatrelvir to circulate in the blood better. Not quite sure I'm buying that fully.

@toolboxybrown I took it for a month for the same reason. I hate pharma so it didn't last, especially since I didn't feel any better. Lyrica hasn't been pulled so maybe its not too bad. For me it's benefit to risk & quality of life. If it worked & I needed it that bad, I might still take it.
@memphis253 my dad does currently for nerve damage
